thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 26 Feb 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: At least 30 killed in eastern Ghouta in 48 hours; aid convoys ready: U.N.

author: Reuters Editorial
title: At least 30 killed in eastern Ghouta in 48 hours; aid convoys ready: U.N.
text:
GENEVA (Reuters) - Military operations have killed at least 30 people, including women and children, in Syria’s besieged eastern Ghouta in the last 48 hours, while shelling on Damascus continues from the rebel-held area, a United Nations spokeswoman said on Monday.
“The United Nations has mobilised and is ready to immediately support life-saving aid convoys to several areas in eastern Ghouta as soon as conditions allow, as well as hundreds of medical evacuations,” Linda Tom, a U.N. humanitarian spokeswoman in Damascus, said in emailed comments.
Reporting by Stephanie Nebehay; editing by Tom Miles
